title: What is a Linked List?
content:
A linked list is a data structure used for storing collections of data. A linked list has the following properties.
- Successive elements are connected by pointers
- The last element points to NULL
- Can grow or shrink in size during execution of a program
- Can be

title: How will you display a linked list from the end?
content:
Traverse recursively till the end of the linked list. While returning back, we can print the elements. This approach will take Time Complexity O(n) as we are traversing through each element at least once and the space complexity of O(n) as we are forming a Stack in the recursion.

title: Discuss Towers of Hanoi Puzzle.
content: The Tower of Hanoi is a mathematical puzzle.  It consists of three rods and a number of disks of different sizes which can slide onto any rod. title: What is Design Patterns?
content: Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software is a software engineering book describing software design patterns. The book's authors are Erich Gamma, Richard Helm, Ralph Johnson and John Vlissides with a foreword by Grady Booch. The book is divided into two parts, with the first

title: What is Composite pattern?
content: In software engineering, the composite pattern is a partitioning design pattern. The composite pattern describes a group of objects that are treated the same way as a single instance of the same type of object.
